Michael Herrmann wrote:
> Thank you very much for your reply,
> I'd be very interested in what the other developers on this mailing list
> think about @Before and @BeforeTestMethod, because the people you have asked
> might think that @BeforeTestMethod reads better if given the option. So to
> everybody who's reading this: please comment on this question.

I would prefer @BeforeTest, @BeforeSuite and their @After* companions.
> 
> What do you think about Joe Walnes' Flexible JUnit
> assertions<http://64.233.161.104/search?q=cache:k4i4bq5MGYMJ:joe.truemesh.com/blog/000511.html+>(this
> is a link to Google's cache because his site seems to be down at the
> moment) and my 
> aproach<http://saloon.javaranch.com/cgi-bin/ubb/ultimatebb.cgi?ubb=get_topic&f=68&t=000944 
> <http://saloon.javaranch.com/cgi-bin/ubb/ultimatebb.cgi?ubb=get_topic&f=68&t=000944>>
> ?

I absolutely love the idea. I would like to try it out.

This brings up one request I'd have for Eclipse: I'd like to be able to 
change the superclass Eclipse chooses when I do New > JUnit Test Case. 
Does anyone know how to do that?
